title: 114_hr5879
content: MODIFICATIONS OF CREDIT FOR PRODUCTION FROM ADVANCED NUCLEAR POWER FACILITIES. The amendment to Section 45J(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 includes the allocation of unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation by the Secretary after December 31, 2020. This allocation is first given to facilities placed in service before that date if they did not receive a full allocation, and then to facilities placed in service after that date. The unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation is defined as the excess of 6,000 megawatts over the total amount allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, minus any allocation to facilities not in service by that date. Any allocation of this limitation is treated similarly to the national megawatt capacity limitation for tax purposes. The section discusses the transfer of credits by certain public entities under Section 45J of the Code. If a taxpayer qualifies as a public entity and elects to transfer the credit, the eligible project partner specified in the election can receive the credit for the taxable year. The eligible project partner specified in the election can receive the credit for the taxable year, instead of the qualified public entity, as defined in the subsection. The terms "qualified public entity" and "eligible project partner" are defined in the subsection for clarity. The term 'eligible project partner' refers to individuals involved in the design, construction, provision of nuclear systems, fuel, or ownership of an advanced nuclear power facility eligible for tax credits. Special rules apply to partnerships. Special rules apply to partnerships regarding the tax credit for advanced nuclear power facilities. A qualified public entity is treated as the taxpayer for their share of the credit, and any partner of the partnership is considered an eligible project partner. The credit must be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner after the qualified public entity's taxable year. Additionally, it mentions specific rules for mutual or cooperative electric companies regarding income received in connection with the tax credit election. The text chunk discusses effective dates for amendments related to the tax credit for advanced nuclear power facilities. The amendment for unutilized limitation amounts is effective upon enactment of the Act, while the transfer of credit by certain public entities applies to taxable years starting after December 31, 2016.
